alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 8:02PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson, Forsyth and Guilford. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of urban areas, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen near Winston-Salem. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, Clemmons, Sedge Garden, Stanleyville, Pfafftown, Lake Brandt and Lake Jeanette Marina.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
